RACE.RACE_TEXT: THISTLEDOWN RACE 1 6F Dirt CR: 74. Starter Optional Claiming Purse 25600. FOR REGISTERED OHIO FOALS FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $8,000 OR LESS IN 2022 - 2023 OR CLAIMING PRICE $12,500. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since April 10 All owed 2 lbs. A Race Since March 10 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CAT'S RHYTHM allowed to settle, advanced steadily through the turn and into the stretch to make the lead at the furlong marker, was put to mild right handed urging and proved best in a game effort. AUJARA was fractious in gate, sprinted p the inside to make the lead soon after the start, set the pace until mid stretch then couldn't handle the winner. JETTIN PEGASUS trailed down the backstretch then passed tiring rivals in the four path. APPEALING SENORITA went evenly. STAR MABEE chased the pace into the turn then faded. CARMEN OHIO was no factor.

ENTRY.NAME: Aujara
ENTRY.COMMENT: fractious in gate, set pace mid stretch, second best,

ENTRY.NAME: Appealing Senorita
ENTRY.COMMENT: evenly,

ENTRY.NAME: Cat's Rhythm
ENTRY.OWNER: Boots N Bikinis LLC and Vigil Alan
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, steady advance 2 wide, 1/8pole lead, driving,

ENTRY.NAME: Jettin Pegasus
ENTRY.COMMENT: trailed, passed tiring rivals 4path

ENTRY.NAME: Carmen Ohio
ENTRY.OWNER: Royer Family Stables LLC and Aurora Racing
ENTRY.COMMENT: no factor,

ENTRY.NAME: Star Mabee
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased, faded turn,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: THISTLEDOWN RACE 2 1M Dirt CR: 72. Claiming Purse 14000. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since April 10 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since March 10 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $7,500 (Ohio Registered Foals Preferred).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: GRAY ROYALITY was on heels near the nine sixteenths pole causing her rider to check, altered course five wide, rallied three wide into the stretch to make the lead before the furlong marker and drew off under right handed urging. CHORIST never far back, surged late in the five path and finished clear for second. ADMONISH unhurried early, had a mild late rally in the six path. MY GIRL MELLY checked and altered course five wide near the five eighths pole, loomed boldly three wide before a half, prompted the pace to the top of the stretch, made the lead then came up empty. TIME FOR CUPID under strong restraint along the rail through the clubhouse turn, was through after a half. YEARS AGO made the lead soon after the start between horses two wide, set the pace for six furlongs then weakened. DREAM TO WIN was unprepared for the start as her head was turned, missed the break, was never involved and declared a non starter. UNCAPTURED FAITH pressed the pace three then two wide for six furlongs then flattened out. THE STEWARDS POSTED THE INIQUIRY SIGN AND AFTER REVIEW DECLARED DREAM TO WIN AS NON STARTER.

ENTRY.NAME: Admonish
ENTRY.OWNER: R and P Racing Stables, LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, mild rally late 6path

ENTRY.NAME: Chorist
ENTRY.COMMENT: never far back, dug in 5path, second best,

ENTRY.NAME: My Girl Melly
ENTRY.COMMENT: checked, altered course 5wide 5/8p, rallied 3w, led between calls

ENTRY.NAME: Time for Cupid
ENTRY.COMMENT: under strong restraint first turn, through after half,

ENTRY.NAME: Dream to Win
ENTRY.COMMENT: unprepared start, head turned, declared non starter

ENTRY.NAME: Years Ago
ENTRY.COMMENT: rushed to lead, set pressured pace 1/4 pole, weakened,

ENTRY.NAME: Gray Royality
ENTRY.COMMENT: on heels 9/16p, checked, angled out, rallied 4w, drew off,

ENTRY.NAME: Uncaptured Faith
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace, 2 wide 1/4 pole, flattened out,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: THISTLEDOWN RACE 3 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 72. Claiming Purse 30800. FOR REGISTERED OHIO FOALS FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since April 10 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since March 10 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $25,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: PANAMANIAC dueled for the lead along the inside until mid stretch then finished full of run to win going away under a brisk hand ride. A SMILE A DAY battled with the winner two wide into the stretch then was no match while gamely hanging on for second. TOTALLY OBSESSED stalked the pace four wide and went evenly. TWERK close up along the inside into the stretch, improved position before the eighth pole, drifted to the five path then failed to sustain that bid. FRONT CIRCLE failed to menace. SUSHI Q stalked the pace three wide through the turn then gave way.

ENTRY.NAME: Totally Obsessed
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 4 wide, evenly,

ENTRY.NAME: Twerk
ENTRY.COMMENT: close inside, drifted 5path, improved, failed to sustain bid,

ENTRY.NAME: Panamaniac
ENTRY.COMMENT: dueled inside, full of run, going away, hand ride

ENTRY.NAME: A Smile a Day
ENTRY.COMMENT: dueled, 2 wide, no match for winner,

ENTRY.NAME: Front Circle
ENTRY.COMMENT: failed to menace,

ENTRY.NAME: Sushi Q
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace, 3 wide, gave way lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: THISTLEDOWN RACE 4 6F Dirt CR: 41. Maiden Special Weight Purse 33900. FOR ACCREDITED OHIO FOALS MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ATILANO'S THUNDER broke slowly and rifted out, circled his field rapidly through the turn and upper stretch, made the lead near the furlong marker and edged clear under mild urging. DANES HEART never far back, steadied behind a rival in mid stretch, altered course four wide, surged late and got up for second. SOL OF VAQUERO allowed to settle, loomed boldly along the inside into the stretch and was outfinished despite a game effort. BRONZE KETTLE found his best stride late in the seven path. IPPOLITO'S WONDER stalked the pace inside, shifted to the six path entering the stretch then went evenly. VEGAS PLAYER failed to menace. HURRYCANE DON was outrun. STRIKING AGAIN vied for lead the lead three wide into the turn, made the lead at the quarter pole, set the pace into the stretch then came up empty. TRANSPIRED broke in front, set the pace in the two path for a half then weakened. MY HOMBRE pressed the pace along the rail and was through after a half. WHY KENNY WHY was through early.

ENTRY.NAME: Ippolito's Wonder
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace, evenly,

ENTRY.NAME: Why Kenny Why
ENTRY.COMMENT: through early,

ENTRY.NAME: Sol of Vaquero
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, loomed boldly inside, outfinished

ENTRY.NAME: My Hombre
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace, inside, through after half,

ENTRY.NAME: Danes Heart
ENTRY.OWNER: McFadden Jr Joseph A and Fewster Melody K
ENTRY.COMMENT: never far back, steadied mid stretch, rallied 4 wide, up place

ENTRY.NAME: Bronze Kettle
ENTRY.COMMENT: best stride late 7path

ENTRY.NAME: Vegas Player
ENTRY.COMMENT: failed to menace,

ENTRY.NAME: Striking Again
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied for lead, 3 wide, narrow lead 1/4 pole, empty,

ENTRY.NAME: Hurrycane Don
ENTRY.COMMENT: outrun,

ENTRY.NAME: Atilano's Thunder
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke slowly, circled field rapidly turn, upper stretch, driving,

ENTRY.NAME: Transpired
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, set pace 1/4 pole, weakened,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: THISTLEDOWN RACE 5 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 72. Allowance Purse 28000. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since April 10 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since March 10 Allowed 4 lbs. (Claiming Races For $12,500 Or Less Not C onsidered In Weight Allowances) (Ohio Registered Foals Preferred).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MITESSE sped to the lead shortly after the start, set all the pace and widened through the stretch to win as much the best under a strong hand ride. MS. THE LAW pressed the pace three, then two wide, inched closer midway on the turn then was no match for the winner. ALWAYS MISCHIEVOUS pressed the early pace along the rail, dropped back on the turn, altered course to the six path then came on again. TWILIGHT VISION saved ground and went evenly. ALSANAH unhurried early, swung wide and had a mild rally late in the nine path. DANZING CHICK had good early speed then faded. LADY GIULIANA failed to menace. KISS ME ON OCONEE trailed.

ENTRY.NAME: Lady Giuliana
ENTRY.COMMENT: failed to menace,

ENTRY.NAME: Twilight Vision
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground, evenly,

ENTRY.NAME: Always Mischievous
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed inside, dropped back turn, altered 6path, came again,

ENTRY.NAME: Alsanah
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, swung wide, mild rally 9path

ENTRY.NAME: Mitesse
ENTRY.COMMENT: quick lead, set pace, full of run, much the best,

ENTRY.NAME: Kiss Me On Oconee
ENTRY.COMMENT: trailed,

ENTRY.NAME: Ms. the Law
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace, 3-2wide, no match for winner,

ENTRY.NAME: Danzing Chick
ENTRY.OWNER: DaCosta Jason and Brown John E
ENTRY.COMMENT: good early speed, faded,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: THISTLEDOWN RACE 6 1M Dirt CR: 102. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 31400. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, OPTIONAL OR OHIO BRED OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $25,000. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since April 10 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since March 10 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $25,000 (Claiming Races For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances) (Ohio Registered Foals Preferred).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: FIRST CITIZEN away alertly, dropped inward putting rivals in tight nearing the first turn while making the lead, gave up the advantage before a quarter, prompted the pace along the rail into the far turn, regained command, swung out to the middle of the racetrack entering the stretch won under right handed urging. THRU THE VINE never far back, loomed boldly along the inside into the stretch, drifted to the six path and finished second best. OBIWAN was in tight and bumped nearing the first turn, never far back, began to rally in the four path on the far turn, dropped inside the drifting leader then finished with good courage between horses. COMPLY stalked the early pace four wide, dropped back on the far turn then came on again late. DISCLOSURE trailed into the stretch, swung out past the middle of the racetrack and passed tiring rivals. RAISON KARTER vied for the lead three wide, offered a bid two wide on the far turn, was forced out by the winner to the middle of the racetrack then came up empty. NIGHT TIME RULER sprinted to the lead two wide before a quarter, set the pace into the far turn then weakened. SURF AND TURF was no factor. CREDIT RIVER was in tight, forced inward by the winner bumping OBIWAN entering the first turn then was no threat. THE STEWARDS POSTED THE INQUIRY BUT TOOK NO ACTION.

ENTRY.NAME: Night Time Ruler
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace 2 wide 2nd turn, weakened,

ENTRY.NAME: Disclosure
ENTRY.COMMENT: trailed, swung wide, passed tiring rivals past mid track

ENTRY.NAME: Surf and Turf
ENTRY.COMMENT: no factor,

ENTRY.NAME: Thru the Vine
ENTRY.COMMENT: never far back, loomed boldly, inside, drifted 6path, second best

ENTRY.NAME: Raison Karter
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied for lead, 3 wide, loomed boldly 2nd turn, forced wide, empty

ENTRY.NAME: Credit River
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped, in tight entering first turn, no threat,

ENTRY.NAME: Obiwan
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped entering first turn, finished well, between horses,

ENTRY.NAME: First Citizen
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed inside, inherited lead 2 turn, drifted mid track,all out

ENTRY.NAME: Comply
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace, 4 wide, dropped back, came again,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: THISTLEDOWN RACE 7 1M Dirt CR: 89. Allowance Purse 41500. FOR REGISTERED OHIO FOALS THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since April 10 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since March 10 Allowed 4 lbs. (Claiming Races For $12,500 Or Less Not Consid ered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: I WANNA WIN unhurried early, circled horses rapidly five wide through the far turn, made the lead before the furlong marker, drew clear and prevailed under strong handling. TANTRUM trailed until mid stretch, closed with a burst of speed in the middle of the racetrack and got up for second. DARK VADER never far back, surged three wide after a half to make the lead entering the far turn, set the pace into the stretch then was outfinished. TO WIN found his best stride late in the six path. MO DONT NO failed to menace. IT'S YOUR CALL chased the pace along the inside and was through after a half. UPTOWN chased the pace two wide in the four path, drew on even terms for the lead entering the far turn, matched strides into the stretch then was used up. WICKED WARRIOR made the lead soon after the start, set the pace for five furlongs, remained a sharp threat into the stretch then was used up. THE STEWARDS POSTED THE INQUIRY SIGN BUT TOOK NO ACTION.

ENTRY.NAME: Tantrum
ENTRY.COMMENT: trailed, swung wide, closed fast mid track

ENTRY.NAME: Dark Vader
ENTRY.COMMENT: never far back, surged 3 wide, 3/8 pole lead, outfinished

ENTRY.NAME: Mo Dont No
ENTRY.COMMENT: failed to menace,

ENTRY.NAME: I Wanna Win
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried, circled 5 wide 2nd turn, shook clear, driving,

ENTRY.NAME: To Win
ENTRY.COMMENT: best stride late 6path

ENTRY.NAME: It's Your Call
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased inside, through after half,

ENTRY.NAME: Wicked Warrior
ENTRY.COMMENT: rushed to lead, set pace 3/8 pole, used up,

ENTRY.NAME: Uptown
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased, 2 wide, 4path, drew even 3/8 pole, used up

RACE.RACE_TEXT: THISTLEDOWN RACE 8 6F Dirt CR: 74. Allowance Purse 38400. FOR REGISTERED OHIO FOALS FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, OPTIONAL, OR STARTER OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Non-winners OfA Race S ince April 10 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since March 10 Allowed 4 lbs. (Claiming Races For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MIDNIGHT IN OHIO sprinted to a clear lead soon after the start, widened on the turn, set all the pace and lasted under right handed urging. DIAMONDS N DEW settled in the four path, drifted to the seven path entering the stretch then closed determinedly but was too late. DRIVEN FOR SUCCESS bobbled at the start and finished with good courage along the rail. CROSSED UP unhurried early, swung wide and closed some ground late. SHAKEURSKINNYLEGS chased the winner into the stretch then weakened. RUNLIKEJACKIEO was no factor. BISCAYNE BAY was outrun. HIGHLY EXPLOSIVE was no threat. COWCHI was through early.

ENTRY.NAME: Cowchi
ENTRY.COMMENT: through early,

ENTRY.NAME: Biscayne Bay
ENTRY.COMMENT: outrun,

ENTRY.NAME: Midnight in Ohio
ENTRY.OWNER: Blue Snow Racing Stables and Boots N Bikinis LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: sprinted clear, set pace, lasted right handed urging,

ENTRY.NAME: Highly Explosive
ENTRY.OWNER: Diamond Oak Stable and Splurgin Racing
ENTRY.COMMENT: no threat,

ENTRY.NAME: Runlikejackieo
ENTRY.OWNER: R and P Racing Stables, LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: no factor,

ENTRY.NAME: Driven for Success
ENTRY.COMMENT: bobbled start, finished well inside,

ENTRY.NAME: Shakeurskinnylegs
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased, weakened lane

ENTRY.NAME: Crossed Up
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, swung wide, closed gap,

ENTRY.NAME: Diamonds N Dew
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 4path, drifted 7path, gaining, good effort,
